body_html:
I rebuild build without C++ API and C++ library

otool -L ./.build/x86_64-apple-macosx10.10/debug/OpProducer
./.build/x86_64-apple-macosx10.10/debug/OpProducer:
	/System/Library/Frameworks/CoreFoundation.framework/Versions/A/CoreFoundation (compatibility version 150.0.0, current version 1443.13.0)
	/usr/local/opt/protobuf/lib/libprotobuf.14.dylib (compatibility version 15.0.0, current version 15.0.0)
	/server/repository/tensorflow/bazel-out/darwin_x86_64-opt/bin/tensorflow/libtensorflow.so (compatibility version 0.0.0, current version 0.0.0)
	/usr/lib/libobjc.A.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 228.0.0)
	/usr/lib/libSystem.B.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 1252.0.0)
	/System/Library/Frameworks/Foundation.framework/Versions/C/Foundation (compatibility version 300.0.0, current version 1443.14.0)
	@rpath/libswiftCore.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 900.0.65)
	@rpath/libswiftCoreFoundation.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 900.0.65)
	@rpath/libswiftCoreGraphics.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 900.0.65)
	@rpath/libswiftDarwin.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 900.0.65)
	@rpath/libswiftDispatch.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 900.0.65)
	@rpath/libswiftFoundation.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 900.0.65)
	@rpath/libswiftIOKit.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 900.0.65)
	@rpath/libswiftObjectiveC.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 900.0.65)
	@rpath/libswiftSwiftOnoneSupport.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 900.0.65)

And that is works fine. It means, that I can't use C and C++ libraries in the same code at the same time.
But in r1.3 it is works. That means, somebody (I think @fritzo at a651023) added C code to C++ library. And after that you can't use both libraries in your code.
I tried build only with C++ library, but unfortunately It doesn't work. There is no enough implementation C code in C++ library.
